title: Recently, the "show more" video description button on YouTube has stopped working.

When I click it, it used to show the full expanded video description. But now all it does is toggle between show more and show less! Nothing else happens anymore! No idea why. I have several different profiles on YouTube. If I switch to a different profile, the "show more" button works. But then, when I switch back to my main profile, it does not work again. This just began happening in the last couple days. The show more button still works in my chrome browser, but I ALWAYS use Firefox. I love it!

I cleared my history and cache, but it didn't fix it.

I have made no changes to my computer or installed any software or add-ons or anything else that might cause this (to my knowledge).

Can you PLEASE help me? Thank you very much!

title: Manual Proxy Settings W/ Nord VPN (Version 95.0.2) - No Login/Password Prompt, Connection Timeout Error
content:
Hello all,

The method for updating manual proxy settings is new to me, admittedly, but with even a tiny bit of research it seems super accessible and straightforward. I am a Nord user who is a little disenchanted with their extension on Firefox, and simply want to use a manual proxy to browse instead.

When updating my proxy settings, I do what every YouTube or WikiHow article would tell you, and I search for the best available Nord server for my region, copy the link directly, apply it to the manual proxy setting, set all proxies to this same link, and set the port to 80.

However, instead of prompting me for a login/password after closing and reopening the browser, every single page instead goes through a connection timeout and ultimately fails to load altogether.

Has anyone else experienced this and discovered a fix? Or can you perhaps guide me through a mistake I am making, perhaps in my process or a setting which I overlooked?

Thank you all very much in advance.
creator: FourthFromHere

title: Blacklisting and/or Blocking Individual Web Sites
content:
I think it's remiss there is not an obvious way to prevent any specified websites I choose, from ever loading on my system. Simple on my iPhone! Not on Windows 10, Mozilla Firefox. 

 I find when I accidentally click things on my touchy touch screen or try to back out of a page I opened in a new tab (Nothing to go back to), sometimes the page is set up to repurpose that action, as a request for an advertisement or some other undesirable page, often the same few abusive jerks.  I Should Be Able, With A Single Click to Block, ANY UNDESIRABLE PAGES!   Why isn't there a simple list, I can populate myself, on my system(?)  again, my iPhone has it!  I'm old.  Reading about widgets and add-ons is like reading Greek, don't get it and don't want to have to learn!  When did everything become self help?  We need answers that say, click here to be directed to a page with an explanation and another button to click, maybe answer a few simple questions (NO Words Invented This Century, PLEASE!), and it is done!  PLEASE!  So, Add A Blacklist Button To My Home Screen!  I feel like there is one, it is just some new term and unsearchable unless I know the new secret made up words!  Ridiculous Everything Is So Damn Hard 90% of my online time is trying to fix crap, find answers, etc. Sucks!
creator: kayakned

title: Firefox blocked over 50,000 trackers since January 2022!
content:
I am seeing popup in Firefox that claims Firefox is doing a wonderful job on making me more secure - "click here".

This is the specific message: "Firefox blocked over 50,000 trackers since January 2022! X See All >"

It is a horrible idea to teach users to click on unexpected popups. I want to turn off this feature, and really think it should be removed OR alternatively send the user to a page that tells them to NOT click on popups!

I found settings for chrome that appears to be part of this logic. I can't find where it is in Firefox or how to turn it off. Please provide instructions to prevent this (and really any popups or tooltips that then provide a link to take me somewhere else).


  1. Footer section in the Protections Panel
  2. LOCALIZATION NOTE (protections.footer.blockedTrackerCounter.description,
  3. protections.footer.blockedTrackerCounter.tooltip):
  4. This text indicates the total number of trackers blocked on all sites. In
  5. its tooltip, we show the date when we started counting this number.
  6. LOCALIZATION NOTE (protections.footer.blockedTrackerCounter.description):
  7. Semicolon-separated list of plural forms.
  8. See: http://developer.mozilla.org/en/docs/Localization_and_Plurals
  9. Replacement for #1 is a locale-string converted positive integer.

protections.footer.blockedTrackerCounter.description=#1 Blocked;#1 Blocked

  1. LOCALIZATION NOTE (protections.footer.blockedTrackerCounter.tooltip):

+ −# %S is the date on which we started counting (e.g., July 17, 2019). protections.footer.blockedTrackerCounter.tooltip=Since %S

title: Unable to disable "Forced HTTPS" (http://egbert.net:80 failed)
content:
On Firefox 92, 93, and 94, I am unable to visit http://egbert.net:80/ in an unsecured manner.

http://egbert.net:80/

This website hosts BOTH secured AND unsecured HTML pages.

I've already tried the following:

- (hamburger)->Settings->Privacy&Security->Don’t enable HTTPS-Only Mode - dom.security.https_only_mode_send_http_background_request = false - network.dns.disablePrefetchFromHTTPS = false - network.dns.httpssvc.reset_exclustion_list = false - network.dns.upgrade_with_https_rr = false - network.dns.use_https_rr_as_altsvc = false - plugins.http_https_only = false - security.disallow_privileged_https_stylesheet_loads = false - security.disallow_privileged_https_subdocuments_loads = false - browser.urlbar.autoFill = false

Wireshark is showing that Firefox is starting with port 443 right out the starting gate.

What else do I have to do to turn off this port 443 for this website?

title: Firefox inconsistent, Session leaks data.
content:
By fixing the very first option you come across as soon as you go into General Under "Startup" The setting called "Restore previous Session"

Usually, a checkbox, is a boolean ON OFF.

Once more, this leaks data. For instance, logging into my webmail rebooting the machine, next time i launch firefox it spawns the same session again. This contradicts with the very first option under "General" -> Startup

If this was a public machine, some one would now have access to my email.

It seems that this is OS specific. But really, i don't care. My complaint stays the same. The option is broken, and firefox leaks data therefor. I no longer trust Firefox. This sort of stuff is not done deliberately.

Once more. perhaps bit logic is too complicated for you UI designers and a quantum gyro is more to your liking? Cause this is NOT normal.

title: Firefox stopped displaying a CSS mask locally
content:
I use Firefox locally to review the HTML/CSS while creating web pages (Win7 & Win10). Upon browser update, Firefox stopped displaying mask of any image format (SVG or PNG).

After a browser update, I don't see the images with a mask, see attachment. The mask images show OK when the HTML page is on the server, but codding requires a constant 'quick check,' and usually uploading to the server is a final step. Can anyone help?

I prepared a simple example page [https://artenergy.com/mask] with a download link. Thus one can open this file locally to see the issue.

Thank you!
